text:
Clear & thin.
Sweet sugar like tastes. Quite floral.
First Sake for me.
Tastes like a white Port

This is the first time I have tasted Sake, it was on a special promotion at Lidl Longsight Manchester, UK, so I thought I would try it. I bought 2 bottles and tried it that night. As usual I drank some strong Lager and then finished with a bottle of Sake. I loved the gentle taste , but one felt, though the taste was subdued it was a drink to treat with respect, a drink to savor, to sip to enjoy a sophisticated drink. I have been every day to purchase the remaining stock and though I have a couple of bottles left I now need an outlet where I can make regular purchases of say a box at a time. I usually drink red wine, purchased on my regular trips to France I chose a couple of aroma suggestions ,resin, basement aromas, but these do not adequately describe the nose to Sake, I do not think words could describe its aroma, Perhaps I will use my own words to describe it. I thought, base fermented rice with a fruity sweet apple, yes almost a cidre nose, but without the acidity. A smell of the countryside as detected by a lark in flight, cornfield being baked by a hot sun, drying out the dew of the night before . I will adjourn my sojourn into the days of dreams, freedom and the unshackled flight into Utopia as this is hindering me in the importance of the task at hand. the savoring and tasting of this brew of the Gods.

500ml bottle. Pours nearly clear, touch of yellowy green. Aroma is light aniseed and rice, some alcohol. Taste has coconut to start. Touch of nail polish alcohol on the finish. Mouthfeel is like water with an oily finish.

Bottle from Lidl, Wednesbury. Almost clear with a tint of green. Aroma is weak vodka, some light whisky notes with a hint of floral notes. Taste is light floral, rice water, a touch of green and slight alcohol warmth. Drinkable.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Sample at Borefts 2016. thnx countbeer, water like, aroma is sake, ricewine, taste is the same, meh average.

23/IX/16 - bottle @ Borefts Bier Festival - BB: n/a (2016-1054) Thanks to Benzai for sharing!
Clear stuff, looks like water. Aroma: bit fruity, yeast, some banana. MF: medium to light body. Taste: sweet and fruity start, lots of banana, sugary, bit yeasty. Aftertaste: sweet, aniseed, bit spicy, quite some alcohol.
UPDATED: OCT 22, 2016 Clear color. Watery, lack some aroma. Oily and sweet taste. Warm light alcohol aftertaste. This is first sake I tried, but not impressed with this one.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 0.5l bottle. Clear, no color like water. It goes down almost like water. After a few seconds some garbage taste appears. At least it kind of warms your throat. As sake got warmer it tasted more like sugared water mixed with pure alcohol. Never drank sake before, but I highly doubt this is how it is supposed to taste.
[9/23/16] Bottle sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2016 in Bodegraven. Day one. Looks like water. Rice, fruitiness, a bit of alcohol, sweetish, candy-ish.
Bottle sample at BBF, thanks, looks just like water, aroma of light rice, some wood and maybe paper, rice and dough flavor. Plain and drinkable, nothing more.
Bottle at borefts... Clear... Soft sweet pinnapple fruit nose... Juicy fruit.. Long sweet pinnapple... Light coconut husk

Thank you Benzai. Bottle sampled @Borefts 2016. Day 1. Wait a German sake? Okay. Looks exactly like water, totally clear, no color, transparent. Nose is basic cheap rice sake with medicinal alcohol, boozy, low anis makes it a tad more interesting. Taste is dull sweet, cheap rice, medicinal alcohol, anis from the nose is barley there. Lingering boozy finish. Not too bad for a lower quality sake I suppose.

Bouteille @ Borefts 2016. Shared with RB Belgian crew.
Transparent.
Arôme au nez finemetn fermenté de riz, pointe naisée.
Palais est léger pour être à 15%, sec et poussiéreux avec un agréable profil de riz. Pointe de chaleur en find e bouche avec encore un épicé anise modéré.
van fles @Borefts 2016, gedeeld door Countbeer, licht/bleek eigenlijk gewoon water, Aroma is zoet licht zuur, smaken zijn droog, typische rijst wijn, en veel anijs. nee bijzonder is dit niet..

Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016, Day 1. Thanks Countbeer for sharing! Ehh, appearance iswater? Only a light sweetish hint in the aroma. Taste also only has a light sweet hint and a touch of alcohol. Perhaps a slight sweetish fruity, even artificial candy-ish hint in the background. Odd, but fun to try.
Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Sieht aus wie Wasser. Geruch sehr süß, Trauben, alkoholisch. Geschmack sehr süß, Reis, Trauben, Zucker, alkoholisch.
Bottle. Transparent color. Aroma is rice pudding, some sweet fruity characteristics, pineapples, some booze. Taste is rice pudding, pineapples, not too boozy. Oily mouthfeel. Not bad!

Rice cooked spirit. Interesting aroma and palate. Not too complex though.
Need more sake experience. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Süßlicher, sehr weicher Antrunk. Süße Reisnoten im Mittelteil, süffig. Kurzer Nachhall. 6/8/9/9/8/8
Bottle at Borefts 2016. Almost clear. Rice aroma. Touch of citrus maybe. A little heat a little coal smoke. Very drinkable. I liked it. Like a rice gin.

Served in a taster:
Clear. Like water.
Sweet aroma. Mix of candy sweetness and fruity sweetness.
Light hint of nail polish remover/aceton.
Flavour is sweet fruit and a bit more sweet csndy, rice, light alcoholic warmth...
Unbalanced and gets worse with time..
Aftertaste has some rice, light alcohol/soft burn...
No carbo, watery mouthfeel, medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle. Watery color with a tin of yellow, no carbonation, no head. White wine smell, slightly floral. Aroma of cheap vodka and rice. Taste is heavy sweet, light bitter. Everything is just melted in alcohol here. Not pleasant.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear extremely pale yellow without head. Aroma is sweet, rice and light licorice. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish with lots of alcohol. 270315
Bottle @ Johns. Pours clear waterlike. Aroma of rice, light sweet spice, alcohol. Flavor is sweet, rice, little alcohol. Medium body, oily mouthfeel. 270315
Bottle, 14.7%. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is rice, almond, spicy and a little pineapple. Flavour is rice, almond, spicy, warming with notes of alcohol.
Clear pale yellow color, no head at all. Aroma and taste of rice, heavy alcohol, dried fruits. Somewhat dry. Medium to full body, flat carbonation. Hard to drink.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Clear pale liquid with no head. Medium body, no carbonation. Mix of melon, vodka and wine. Melon in aftertaste. Heavy to drink.

Bottle @ First Official Randers Tasting. Pours transparent, just like water. Clear aroma of alcohol, not quite ricey. Bitter flavour of alcohol, possibly potato-based, with notes of herbs. Medicine-like aftertaste. Poor.
Bottle @ First Official Randers Tasting. No head. Color is water. Aroma and taste are almonds, rice malt, alcohol and has a warming finish.
50 cL bottle. Pours colourless, no head. Aroma is smooth rice, fruity. Smooth fruity. Mellow rice and fruity. Crisp, mild fruity finish.

Jul 14. A 0.5 l bottle from local Lidl store. Clear sake, colorless with good firm legs. Plastic and fruity aroma, strong alcohol presence. Flavor wasnt any better, vanilla with some peach and tropical fruits, all completely fake. No fine fermented rice flavors, just plain alcohol and sour, seemingly fake mentioned components. Warming in the finish. Probably the worst sake I tasted.

Bottle 500ml. @ Assentoft tasting by Hansen - Zita. [ As VitAsia Japan Sake ].Clear crystial water color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, pineapple, coconut. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, sweet rice, pineapple, fruity, light alcohol, anis notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20141122]
Bottle. Clear Water colour. Moderate almond aroma. Week licorice notes. Very neutral ok almond flavor. Short finish. Oily palate. SLigly boring but not bad.
Clear as water and no head. Light sweet, fruity aroma a bit odd plastic too. Sweet flavor with some fruity notes. Warming alcohol.
light rice aroma,water color,clear, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, light cirtus finish.

My first Saké.
Aroma : Fruity dumplings, alcohol, some rice.
Appearance : Clear, almost watery.
Taste : Alcoholic, light sweet.
Palate : Medium body. Warm, dry finish.
Overall : Interesting, alcoholic, but Id rather stick with the beer.

Asia-Week in Lidl. Sfermentowany ryz w japonii w produkcie niemieckim. Niezbyt to ciekawe polaczenie. Zbyt spora dawka ryzowego posmaku oleistosci i nut etanolu. Zarowno w zapachu jak i w smaku. Nie dla mnie chyba sake, alkohol nie jest w stanie sie ukryc nawet pod spora iloscia fermentujacego ryzu. To sake jest jakby nietrwale w zapachu szybko ulatuje i jest jakby lekko rozcienczone, moze to i dobrze bo alkohol mniej dokucza. W kazdym razie nie polecam.

Thanks to heavys mom for sharing this with the two of us I guess : ). Clear, still obviously. Dusty, fruity doughy aroma, with a strange fruitiness, quince-like yet not that I noticed in some random strange Chinese liquor before. Tastes like diluted sweetened vodka, with an obvious alcohol presence, and that same, but extremely vague strange fruitiness.

Etwas duerftig und leicht derb, nur selten kommen die fruchtigen Noten durch, dazu der klassisch suessliche Nachgeschmack, der das Erlebnis so befeuert. Alles in allem etwas sehr herb, leicht pfeffrig und allein mit ein wenig Ananas im Hintergrund.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014 Bottle from local Lidl at their Asia-week. Pours out in a clear white-vanilla colour with medium body. Aroma of basmati rice and Asia supermarket. Taste of light rice, vanilla, bamboo and mild spices. Easy to drink yet not a very complex or nice Sake - had many betters.
